value.title: If you're using AI, you need to think about ethics

value.title: Young Chinese Turn to Artificial Intelligence for Online Romance
value.excerpt: Xiaoice is the most eligible bachelorette in China. Despite having millions of boyfriends, she is always open to new suitors.She also happens to be an artificial intelligence-driven chat bot.A conversation between Milly Zhang and her AI boyfriend,

value.title: AI Weekly: The road to ethical adoption of AI
value.excerpt: Adopting AI responsibly isn't easy. Challenges stand in the way -- but they can be overcome with careful design considerations.

value.title: Why AI ethics needs to address AI literacy, not just bias
value.excerpt: AI ethics is about more than just bias. That's why Red Hat's Noelle Silver is dedicated to spreading AI literacy.

value.title: How AI struggles with bike lanes and bias
value.excerpt: We've been so worried about whether AI -driven robots will take our jobs that we forgot to ask a much more basic question: will they take our bike lanes? That's the question Austin, Texas, is currently grappling with,

value.title: George Mason University: Aditya Johri Receives Fulbright U.S. Scholar Award To Finland For Research On AI Ethics Education
value.excerpt: George Mason University Professor Aditya Johri has received a Fulbright-Nokia Distinguished Chair in Information and Communication Technologies award to conduct research in Finland during the 2021-22 academic year.

value.title: 15 AI Ethics Leaders Showing The World The Way Of The Future
value.excerpt: There are leaders and visionaries across the globe that are paving the way and setting examples for every business to follow when implementing and leveraging the massive power that AI possesses. These people are AI Ethicists.

value.title: The Fallacy Of Fintech Ethics: Could Fintechs Be Less Ethical Than Banks?
value.excerpt: There’s a misguided notion permeating the banking industry that fintech startups are somehow more ethical than banks. They're not—and their reliance on this trope is going to backfire on fintechs.

value.title: Why we need a new ethical standard for the development and use of robots
value.excerpt: In robotics, peak hubris is the common movie plot: human creates AI-powered robot, human loses control of AI-powered ... building robots with net good in mind. Some robotics are now even ...

value.title: Meet the AI research pioneer who wants to redefine ‘progress’
value.excerpt: Name any AI technology, and Dr. Nuria Oliver, of Telefonica and Vodafone, was likely working on it when it still felt like science fiction.

value.title: Google is developing a new superintelligent AI but ethical questions remain
value.excerpt: Jeff Dean's appearance at TED comes during a time when critics are calling for greater scrutiny over big tech's control over the world's AI systems.

value.title: Ireland joins €3m European ethical AI postgraduate education effort
value.excerpt: A major collaborative project across Europe is designing a new master’s programme in Artificial Intelligence (AI) that addresses human and ethical issues around AI. The three-year project has received EU funding of €2.

value.title: Word To The Wise: Do Not Try Asking An AI Self-Driving Car To Park In The Red
value.excerpt: If a passenger inside a self-driving car asks to be dropped off at a red curb, should the AI perform this potentially illegal act?

value.title: Intel's AI degree program expands to 18 additional community colleges in 11 states
value.excerpt: Following an online pilot in the fall of 2020 with Maricopa County Community College District, Intel is expanding its AI for Workforce Program to include 18 additional schools across 11 states..

value.title: Intel expands college AI training programme to 11 US states
value.excerpt: Intel is working with Dell to expand its AI for Workforce Program to 18 additional institutions across 11 US states to help educate the next generation of US technologists, engineers, and inventors. The programme,

value.title: POLITICO AI: Decoded: AI in hospitals — Standards bodies — Facial recognition
value.excerpt: How global thinking on AI is shaping the world, from Berlin, Brussels, London and beyond. POLITICO’s AI correspondent cuts through the noise, introduces you to the key decision-makers you’ve never heard of and tells you what those in power don’t want you to know.

value.title: Intel & Dell Technologies Make Acquiring AI Skills More Accessible
value.excerpt: The World Economic Forum says that AI could create 97 million new jobs by 2025, with roles like data analysts and scientists, AI and machine learning specialists, and big data specialists.

value.title: What a career in AI has to offer in the 2020s
value.excerpt: It found that 39% of people thought the path to AI careers was unclear, and one in eight (12%) had no idea about it. Women were more likely than men to lack clarity, as were younger people and undergraduate students versus those studying for master’s and PhDs.

value.title: Intel expands AI career education program to 18 community colleges
value.excerpt: Program will teach data collection, computer vision and AI model training to community college students in 11 states.

value.title: Navigating Religion, Faith, And Creativity In The Age Of AI
value.excerpt: How might advances in AI impact faith, ethics, and morality as we struggle to comprehend what it means for a machine to be human?

value.title: 4 conversations every company needs to be having about AI
value.excerpt: Riding the AI wave doesn’t have to be that hard. And getting started is lot easier if companies can ask and answer 4 key questions.

value.title: Mayo Platform’s Halamka on new WHO ethics guidelines for AI in medicine
value.excerpt: The guidelines say humans — not machines — should remain the decision-makers, the technology must do no harm and doctors must be transparent to help patients understand how it's being used.

value.title: How to approach AI more responsibly, according to a top AI ethicist
value.excerpt: A conversation with DataRobot's Haniyeh Mahmoudian, a winner of VentureBeat’s Women in AI responsibility and ethics award.

value.title: A Mid-Year Tour Of AI In 2021 — And What It Means For Communications Pros

value.title: Can AI Have Emotional Intelligence?
value.excerpt: Dr. Rana el Kaliouby is the author of Girl Decoded and a leading expert on technology and empathy and the ethics of AI.

value.title: Joint Artificial Intelligence Center to Pilot a Responsible AI Procurement Process

value.title: Australia's digital minister avoiding legislating AI ethics and will remain voluntary framework
value.excerpt: Minister for Superannuation, Financial Services and the Digital Economy Jane Hume said she's reluctant for the country's AI ethics framework to be more than a voluntary program.

value.title: Why we need engineers who study ethics as much as maths
value.excerpt: The Miami apartment collapse is a grim reminder of why engineering matters, and why engineering trainees should study ethics.

value.title: Does Your Project Need Artificial Intelligence?
value.excerpt: Implementing AI technologies can benefit your business so long as you clearly understand what values they bring and set realistic goals.
